info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued July 13 at 9:36PM MDT until July 13 at 10:00PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1015 PM MDT FOR NORTHWESTERN UNION AND NORTHEASTERN COLFAX COUNTIES... At 936 PM MDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 7 miles south of Trinchera to 8 miles west of Raton, moving south at 20 mph. HAZARD...Two inch hail and 60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Raton, Des Moines, Folsom, Raton Crews Airport, Capulin, Sugarite Canyon State Park and Sugarite. This includes the following highways... Interstate 25 between Mile Markers 431 and 460. Highway 64 between Mile Markers 324 and 378. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...2.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
